title: Iberian Peninsula
summary: The Iberian Peninsula /aɪˈbɪəriən/,[lower-alpha 1] also known as Iberia,[lower-alpha 2] is a peninsula in the southwest corner of Europe, defining the westernmost edge of Eurasia. It is principally divided between Spain and Portugal, comprising most of their territory, as well as a small area of Southern France, Andorra and Gibraltar. With an area of approximately 583,254 square kilometres (225,196 sq mi),[1] and a population of roughly 53 million,[2] it is the second largest European peninsula by area, after the Scandinavian Peninsula.
